Package com.henri.Server

Interface AppServerInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppServerImpl
    public interface AppServerInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Interface class which lets the client access app server methods

    • Method Detail

      • registerForCallback

        void registerForCallback​(int controllerId,
                         CallbackClientInterface callbackClientObject,
                         int gameId)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which enable clients to register their callback interfaces at the app server. this function is synchronized to ensure mutual exclusion.
        Parameters:
        controllerId - The id of the controller which registers the callback and is used as the key in the @HashMap
        callbackClientObject - The object of the client callback interface
        gameId - The Id of the game for which the callback is being registered
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

      • removeCallback

        void removeCallback​(int controllerId)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which removes callbacks from the HashMap
        Parameters:
        controllerId - The Id from the controller which initially requested the registration of the callback and now wants to remove it
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

      • setupMessage

        java.lang.String setupMessage​(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which checks the credentials of the user.
        Parameters:
        username - The name of the user
        password - The password of the user
        Returns:
        String The response from the Database Server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI * @see RemoteException

               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which checks if the username has been taken yet.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user
        Returns:
        boolean True if username hasn't been used yet, false if it has been

      • createGame

        void createGame​(java.lang.String gameConfig,
                java.lang.String username)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which creates a new game depending on the game size.
        Parameters:
        gameConfig - String which contains the number of players, the game size and the game theme
        username - The user who requested to create the game
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:

        username - The username of the user

        ArrayList List with all the games and their information as strings

      • checkTurn

        boolean checkTurn​(int gameId,
                  int userId)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which checks if the given user is at turn.
        Parameters:
        gameId - Id of the game which has to be checked
        userId - The username of the user which wants to check if it's his turn
        Returns:
        Boolean which is is true when it's the users turn and false if not
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

      • requestGameConfig

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> requestGameConfig​(int gameId)
                                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which requests the current game configuration.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The Id of the game of which the configuration is requested
        Returns:
        ArrayList List with the entire configuration of the game as strings
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

      • updateGame

        void updateGame​(int gameId,
                int userId,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> gamePositions,
                int score,
                int controllerType)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which updates a game. It will propagate this update to the Database Server and inform all clients which are currently viewing this game via their registered callbacks.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The Id of the game which is to be updated. This is used to find all callbacks which need to be invoked.
        userId - The username of the user which requests the update
        gamePositions - Current settings of the memory cards
        score - The score the user acquired during his turn
        controllerType - Used with the callback, required at the client side to cast to the right controller
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

      • requestGameWinner

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> requestGameWinner​(int gameId)
                                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which requests the game winner for a given game.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The Id o the given game
        Returns:
        ArrayList List withe the name(s) of the winner(s) as strings
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

      • updateCardFlip

        void updateCardFlip​(int buttonId,
                    int gameId,
                    int controllerId,
                    int controllerType)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which updates current game viewers when a user flips a card. All registered callbacks for this game will be informed.
        Parameters:
        buttonId - Id of the button which has been pressed, this enables other clients to figure out which button they need to de-activate en show the image of
        gameId - The Id of the game which is being player, needed for the lookups in the HashMap which contains the callbacks for current viewers
        controllerId - To make sure the player who is playing doe snot get the callback message
        controllerType - Required for correct casting at the client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

      • checkSessionIdentifier

        boolean checkSessionIdentifier​(int sessionId,
                               java.lang.String sessionIdentifier)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which checks if the sessionIdentifier is still valid
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The data base ID of the session Id
        sessionIdentifier - The current session Id
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true when the Id is still active, false if not
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Necessary because of the RMI
        See Also:
        RemoteException

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> requestTopPlayers()
                                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which requests the overall top players in the application.
        Returns:
        ArrayList List with the names and scores of the top players as strings
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • enterGame

        Game enterGame​(int gameId)
        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which lets a player enter a certain game.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The id of the game
        Returns:
        Game The game which the user entered for backup purposes
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • checkGameAvailability

        boolean checkGameAvailability​(int gameId)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which checks whether the game is active on the current app server
        Parameters:
        gameId - The id of the game
        Returns:
        boolean True if the game resides on this app server, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • checkGameOnOtherServer

        int checkGameOnOtherServer​(int gameId)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which checks if the game is residing on another app server
        Parameters:
        gameId - The id of the game
        Returns:
        int The port of the app server if the game resides on another app server, -1 otherwise
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • enterNewGame

        Game enterNewGame​(int gameId)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Function which lets a user enter a new game and stores this game on the app server
        Parameters:
        gameId - The id of the game
        Returns:
        Game The game object for backup purposes
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
